summary: This bill, the Securing Help for Immigrants through Education and Legal Development Act (SHIELD Act), authorizes the Attorney General to provide grants to states, local governments, and organizations. These grants aim to support the recruitment, training, and development of staff and infrastructure needed to provide legal representation to individuals facing deportation. The bill highlights the importance of legal counsel in removal proceedings and addresses the need for a stronger legal services workforce in the immigration system. It also authorizes $100 million in appropriations for fiscal years 2026 and 2027.
